title: New connection configuration fields are not inheritted (1.77)
author: app/
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Context
In 1.77 new configuration fields for connections are introduced. Like Redirect clipboard.
How to enable inheritance for this on all existing connections at once?

## Your Environment
<!--- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->
* Version used: 1.77
* Operating System and version (e.g. Windows 10 1709 x64): Windows 10 1809

comments.snippet: See #870 for a feature request which covers that
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet:
Is this to inherit all settings. Or also for single settings like the redirect clipboard?
What I mean is that for the current settings I like how the inheritance is set in my configuration.
I just want to enable the inheritance for new settings.
So my default inheritance is set to inherit all and on subfolders I removed it on specific settings like username/password etc. I don't want to reset the inheritance there.

That feature is for pushing inheritance from a top-level folder to its children. Currently, it pushes all inheritance settings from the parent to children (can't pick just one). Though typically you want all child connections to inherit the same settings from a folder. If the folder has `inherit username/password=false` but `inherit redirect clipboard=true`, then the children will also get those settings.
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet:
Having the same issue (bug) in the latest version: 1.77.0.41252.

Fields which have been inherited in the past are no longer actually inherited, despite being shown as inheritance enabled. This is most noticed via the various redirects (key combinations, clipboard, drives). Since inheritance doesn't actually work, each redirect setting must be set on each object manually.
